<line: 9> JUDGMENT IN A CRIMINAL CASE

[ABANDON]
<line: 11> UNITED STATES OF AMERICA

[TITLE]
<line: 13> THE DEFENDANT:

[TEXT]
<line: 15> pleaded guilty to count(s)
<line: 16> Counts One, Two and Three of the Indictment filed on April 19, 2016

[TEXT]
<line: 18>  pleaded nolo contendere to count(s)
<line: 19> which was accepted by the court.
<line: 20>  was found guilty on count(s)
<line: 21> after a plea of not guilty..

[TEXT]
<line: 23> The defendant is adjudicated guilty of these offenses:

[ABANDON]
<line: 25> Title & Section
<line: 26> Nature of Offense
<line: 27> Offense Ended
<line: 28> Count
<line: 29> 21 U.S.C. SS 841(a)(1), 841(b)(1)(C)
<line: 30> Possession of Cocaine Base with Intent to Distribute
<line: 31> 01/21/2016
<line: 32> One
<line: 33> 21 U.S.C. S$ 841(a)(1), 841(b)(1)(C)
<line: 34> Two
<line: 35> Distribution of a Mixture or Substance Containing a Detectable Amount of Heroin
<line: 36> 01/21/2016
<line: 37> 21 U.S.C. SS 841(a)(1), 841(b)(1)(C)
<line: 38> Possession with Intent to Distribute a Mixture or Substance
<line: 39> 01/21/2016
<line: 40> Three
<line: 41> Containing a Detectable Amount of Heroin.
<line: 42> See additional count(s) on page 2

[TEXT]

[TEXT]
<line: 45> The defendant is sentenced as provided in pages 2 through 6 of this judgment. The sentence is imposed pursuant to the
<line: 46> Sentencing Reform Act of 1984.

[TEXT]
<line: 48>  The defendant has been found not guilty on count(s)

[TEXT]
<line: 50>  is
<line: 51>  are dismissed on the motion of the United States.

[TEXT]
<line: 53>  Count(s)

[ABANDON]
<line: 55> It is ordered that the defendant must notify the UnitedStates attorney for this district within 30 days of any change of name, residence,
<line: 56> or mailing address until all fines, restitution, costs, and special assessments imposed by this judgment are fully paid. If ordered to pay restitution,
<line: 57> the defendant must notify the court and United States attorney of material changes in economic circumstances.

<line: 5> Sheet 2 - Imprisonment

[ABANDON]
<line: 7> AO 245B

[TEXT]
<line: 9> Judgment Page: 2 of 6

[TEXT]
<line: 11> DEFENDANT: Donell Jamar Hines
<line: 12> CASE NUMBER: 3:16-cr-00022-001

[TITLE]
<line: 14> IMPRISONMENT

[TEXT]
<line: 16> The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a
<line: 17> total term of:.

[TEXT]
<line: 19> 48 months as to each of Counts One, Two and Three of the Indictment filed on April 19, 2016, all counts to be served
<line: 20> concurrently.e

[ABANDON]
<line: 22> The court makes the following recommendations to the Bureau of Prisons:

[TEXT]

[TEXT]
<line: 25> The Court recommends the defendant be placed at the Bureau of Prisons' facility located in Milan, Michigan, and be
<line: 26> considered for participation in the Residential Drug Abuse Treatment Program (RDAP), if commensurate with his security ano
<line: 27> classification needs..

[ABANDON]
<line: 29> The defendant is remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal..

[TEXT]

[TEXT]
<line: 32>  The defendant shall surrender to the United States Marshal for this district:.

[TEXT]
<line: 34>  The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons:.

[TEXT]
<line: 36>  before
<line: 37> on
<line: 38>  as notified by the United States Marshal..
<line: 39>  as notified by the Probation or Pretrial Services Office.

[TITLE]
<line: 41> RETURN

[TEXT]
<line: 43> I have executed this judgment as follows:.

[ABANDON]
<line: 45> Defendant delivered on
<line: 46> to

[ABANDON]
<line: 48> a
<line: 49> .with a certified copy of this judgment.

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 3:16-cr-00022-SMR-SBJDocument 30 Filed 10/17/16  Page 3 of 6
<line: 3> (Rev. 09/15) Judgment in a Criminal Case
<line: 4> Sheet 3 - Supervised Release

[ABANDON]
<line: 6> AO 245B

[TEXT]
<line: 8> Judgment Page: 3 of 6

[TEXT]
<line: 10> DEFENDANT: Donell Jamar Hines
<line: 11> CASE NUMBER: 3:16-cr-00022-001

[TITLE]
<line: 13> SUPERVISED RELEASE

[TEXT]
<line: 15> Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of :

[TEXT]
<line: 17> Three years as to each of Counts One, Two, and Three of the Indictment filed on April 19, 2016, all counts to be served
<line: 18> concurrently.

[TEXT]
<line: 20> The defendant must report to the probation office in the district to which the defendant is released within 72 hours of release from the
<line: 21> custody of the Bureau of Prisons.

[TEXT]
<line: 23> The defendant shall not commit another federal, state or local crime.

[TEXT]
<line: 25> The defendant shall not unlawfully possess a controlled substance. The defendant shall refrain from any unlawful use of a controlled
<line: 26> substance. The defendant shall submit to one drug test within 15 days of release from imprisonment and at least two periodic drug tests
<line: 27> thereafter, as determined by the court..

[TEXT]
<line: 29> The above drug testing condition is suspended, based on the court's determination that the defendant poses a low risk of
<line: 30> future substance abuse. (Check, if applicable.)

[TEXT]
<line: 32>  The defendant shall not possess a firearm, ammunition, destructive device, or any other dangerous weapon. (Check, if applicable.)

[TEXT]
<line: 34>  The defendant shall cooperate in the collection of DNA as directed by the probation officer. (Check, if applicable.)

[TEXT]
<line: 36> The defendant shall comply with the requirements of the Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act (42 U.S.C.  16901, et seq.)
<line: 37> as directed by the probation officer, the Bureau of Prisons, or any state sex offender registration agency in which he or she resides,
<line: 38> works, is a student, or was convicted of a qualifying offense. (Check, if applicable.)

[TEXT]
<line: 40>  The defendant shall participate in an approved program for domestic violence. (Check, if applicable.)

[TEXT]
<line: 42> If this judgment imposes a fine or restitution, it is a condition of supervised release that the defendant pay in accordance with the
<line: 43> Schedule of Payments sheet of this judgment..

[TEXT]
<line: 45>  The defendant must comply with the standard conditions that hae been adopted by this court as well as with any additional conditions
<line: 46> on the attached page.

[TITLE]
<line: 48> STANDARD CONDITIONS OF SUPERVISION

[TEXT]
<line: 50> 1)
<line: 51>  the defendant shall not leave the judicial district without the permission of the court or probation officer;
<line: 52> 2)
<line: 53> the defendant shall report to the probation officer in a manner and frequency directed by the court or probation office;
<line: 54> 3)
<line: 55> the defendant shall answer truthfully all inquiries by the probation officer and follow the instructions of the probation officer;
<line: 56> 4)
<line: 57> the defendant shall support his or her dependents and meet other family responsibilities;
<line: 58> 5)
<line: 59>  the defendant shall work regularly at a lawful occupation, unless excused by the probation officer for schooling, training, or other
<line: 60> acceptable reasons;
<line: 61> 6)
<line: 62> the defendant shall notify the probation officer at least ten days prior to any change in residence or employment;
<line: 63> 7)
<line: 64> the defendant shall refrain from excessive use of alcohol and shall not purchase, possess, use, distribute, or administer any
<line: 65> controlled substance or any paraphernalia related to any controlled substances, except as prescribed by a physician;
<line: 66> 8)
<line: 67> the defendant shall not frequent places where controlled substances are illegally sold, used, distributed, or administered;
<line: 68> 9)
<line: 69> the defendant shall not associate with any persons engaged in criminal activity and shall not associate with any person convicted of a
<line: 70> felony, unless granted permission to do so by the probation officer;
<line: 71> 10)
<line: 72>  the defendant shall permit a probation officer to visit himor her at any time at home or elsewhere and shall permit confiscation of any
<line: 73> contraband observed in plain view of the probation officer;.
<line: 74> 11)
<line: 75> the defendant shall notify the probation officer within seventy-two hours of being arrested or questioned by a law enforcement officer;
<line: 76> 12)
<line: 77> the defendant shall not enter into any agreement to act as an informer or a special agent of a law enforcement agency without the
<line: 78> permission of the court; and

[TEXT]
<line: 80> 13)
<line: 81>  as directed by the probation officer, the defendant shall notify third parties of risks that may be occasioned by the defendant's criminal
<line: 82> cord or personal history or characteristics and shall permit the probation officer to make such notifications and to confirmthe
<line: 83> defendant's compliance with such notification requirement..

[ABANDON]
<line: 2>  Sheet 3C — Supervised Release
<line: 3> AO 245B            (Rev. 09/15) Judgment in a Criminal Case
<line: 4> Case 3:16-cr-00022-SMR-SBJ   Document 30   Filed 10/17/16   Page 4 of 6

[ABANDON]
<line: 6> v1

[TEXT]
<line: 8> Judgment Page: 4 of 6

[TEXT]
<line: 10> DEFENDANT:
<line: 11> CASE NUMBER:
<line: 12> Donell Jamar Hines
<line: 13> 3:16-cr-00022-001

[TITLE]
<line: 15> SPECIAL CONDITIONS OF SUPERVISION

[TEXT]
<line: 17> The defendant shall participate in a program of testing and/or treatment for substance abuse, as directed by the Probation 
<line: 18> Officer, until such time as the defendant is released from the program by the Probation Office.  At the direction of the 
<line: 19> probation office, the defendant shall receive a substance abuse evaluation and participate in inpatient and/or outpatient 
<line: 20> treatment, as recommended.  Participation may also include compliance with a medication regimen. The defendant will 
<line: 21> contribute to the costs of services rendered (co-payment) based on ability to pay or availability of third party payment.  The 
<line: 22> defendant shall not use alcohol and/or other intoxicants during the course of supervision. 

[TEXT]
<line: 24> The defendant shall not patronize business establishments where more than fifty percent of the revenue is derived from 
<line: 25> the sale of alcoholic beverages. 

[TEXT]
<line: 27> The defendant shall submit to a search of his person, property, residence, adjacent structures, office, vehicle, papers, 
<line: 28> computers (as defined in 18 U.S.C. § 1030(e)(1)), and other electronic communications or data storage devices or media, 
<line: 29> conducted by a U.S. Probation Officer.  Failure to submit to a search may be grounds for revocation.  The defendant shall 
<line: 30> warn any other residents or occupants that the premises and/or vehicle may be subject to searches pursuant to this 
<line: 31> condition.  An officer may conduct a search pursuant to this condition only when reasonable suspicion exists that the 
<line: 32> defendant has violated a condition of his release and/or that the area(s) or item(s) to be searched contain evidence of this 
<line: 33> violation or contain contraband.  Any search must be conducted at a reasonable time and in a reasonable manner.  This 
<line: 34> condition may be invoked with or without the assistance of law enforcement, including the U.S. Marshals Service. 

[TEXT]
<line: 36> If not released to such a facility by the Bureau of Prisons, the defendant shall reside, participate, and follow the rules of the 
<line: 37> residential reentry program, as directed by the U.S. Probation Officer, for up to 120 days. The residential reentry program 
<line: 38> is authorized to allow up to six hours of pass time per week for good conduct when the defendant becomes eligible in 
<line: 39> accordance with the residential reentry program standards. 

[TEXT]
<line: 41> The defendant shall submit to a mental health evaluation.  If treatment is recommended, the defendant shall participate in 
<line: 42> an approved treatment program and abide by all supplemental conditions of treatment.  Participation may include 
<line: 43> inpatient/outpatient treatment and/or compliance with a medication regimen.  The defendant will contribute to the costs of 
<line: 44> services rendered (co-payment) based on ability to pay or availability of third party payment. 

[TEXT]
<line: 46> The defendant shall submit to a gambling assessment and participate in any recommended treatment.  The defendant 
<line: 47> shall abide by all supplemental conditions of treatment.  The defendant shall contribute to the costs of services rendered 
<line: 48> (co-payment) based on ability to pay or availability of third party payment.  The defendant shall not participate in gambling 
<line: 49> or frequent residences or establishments where gambling is ongoing. 

[ABANDON]
<line: 2> Case 3:16-cr-00022-SMR-SBJ

[TITLE]
<line: 15> CRIMINAL MONETARY PENALTIES

[TEXT]
<line: 17> The defendant must pay the total criminal monetary penalties under the schedule of payments on Sheet 6.

[TEXT]
<line: 19> Assessment
<line: 20> TOTALS
<line: 21> $ 300.00

[TEXT]
<line: 23> Fine
<line: 24> $ 0.00

[TEXT]
<line: 26> Restitution
<line: 27> $ 0.00

[TEXT]
<line: 29>  The determination of restitution is deferred until
<line: 30> .An Amended Judgment in a Criminal Case (A0 245c) will be entered.
<line: 31> after such determination.

[TEXT]
<line: 33>  The defendant must make restitution (including community restitution) to the following payees in the amount listed below.

[TEXT]
<line: 35> If the defendant makes a partial payment, each payee shall receive an approximately proportioned payment, unless specified otherwise in
<line: 36> the priority order or percentage payment column below. However, pursuant to 18 U.s.C. s 3664(i), all nonfederal victims must be paid
<line: 37> before the United States is paid

[TITLE]
<line: 39> Name of Payee
<line: 40> Total Loss*
<line: 41> Restitution Ordered
<line: 42>  Priority or Percentage
<line: 43> TOTALS
<line: 44> $0.00
<line: 45> $0.00

[TEXT]
<line: 47> Restitution amount ordered pursuant to plea agreement $

[TEXT]
<line: 49> The defendant must pay interest on restitution and a fine of more than $2,500, unless the restitution or fine is paid in full before the
<line: 50> fifteenth day after the date of the judgment, pursuant to 18 U.S.C.  3612(f). All of the payment options on Sheet 6 may be subject
<line: 51> to penalties for delinquency and default, pursuant to 18 U.S.C.  3612(g)

[ABANDON]

[TEXT]
<line: 54> The court determined that the defendant does not have the ability to pay interest and it is ordered that:

[TEXT]
<line: 56> the interest requirement is waived for the
<line: 57>  fine restitution.
<line: 58> the interest requirement for the
<line: 59>  fine
<line: 60>  restitution is modified as follows:

[TEXT]
<line: 62> * Findings for the total anmunt of losses are required under Chapters 109A, 110, 110A, and 113A of Title 18 for offenses committed on or after
<line: 63> September 13, 1994, but before April 23, 1996.

[ABANDON]

[TITLE]
<line: 15> SCHEDULE OF PAYMENTS

[TEXT]
<line: 17> Having assessed the defendant's ability to pay, payment of the total criminal monetary penalties is due as follows:

[TEXT]
<line: 19> A
<line: 20> Lump sum payment of$300.00
<line: 21> due immediately, balance due
<line: 22>  not later than
<line: 23> , or
<line: 24> in accordance
<line: 25>  c,
<line: 26>  D,
<line: 27> E, or
<line: 28> F below; or
<line: 29> B
<line: 30>  Payment to begin immediately (may be combined with
<line: 31> C,
<line: 32>  D,or
<line: 33>  F below); or
<line: 34> C
<line: 35> 0
<line: 36>  Payment in equal
<line: 37> (e.g., weekly, monthly, quarterly) installments of $
<line: 38> over a period of
<line: 39> (e.g., months or years), to commence
<line: 40> (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after the date of this judgment; or
<line: 41> D
<line: 42>  Payment in equal
<line: 43> (e.g., weekly, monthly, quarterly) installments of $
<line: 44> over a period of
<line: 45> (e.g., months or years), to commence
<line: 46> (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after release from imprisonment to a
<line: 47> term of supervision; or
<line: 48> E
<line: 49>  Payment during the term of supervised release will commence within
<line: 50> (e.g., 30 or 60 days) after release from
<line: 51> imprisonment. The court will set the payment plan based on an assessment of the defendant's ability to pay at that time; or
<line: 52> 1
<line: 53> Special instructions regarding the payment of criminal monetary penalties:
<line: 54> All criminal monetary payments are to be made to the Clerk's Office, U.S. District Court, P.O. Box 9344,
<line: 55> Des Moines, IA. 50306-9344.
<line: 56> While on supervised release, you shall cooperate with the Probation Officer in developing a monthly payment plan
<line: 57> consistent with a schedule of allowable expenses provided by the Probation Office.

[TEXT]
<line: 59> Unless the court has expressly ordered otherwise, if this judgment imposes imprisonment, payment of criinal monetary penalties is due during
<line: 60> imprisonment. All crimnal monetary penalties, except those payments made through the'Federal Bureau of Prisons' Inmate Financ ial
<line: 61> Responsibility Program, are made to the clerk of the court.

[TEXT]
<line: 63> The defendant shall receive credit for all payments previously made toward any criminal monetary penalties imposed

[TEXT]
<line: 65> Defendant and Co-Defendant Names and Case Numbers (including defendant number), Total Amount, Joint and Several Amount,
<line: 66> and corresponding payee, if appropriate.

[TEXT]
<line: 68> The defendant shall pay the cost of prosecution..
<line: 69> The defendant shall pay the following court cost(s):
<line: 70> The defendant shall forfeit the defendant's interest in the following property to the United States:

[TEXT]
<line: 72> Payments shall be applied in the following order: (1) assessment, (2) restitution principal, (3) restitution interest, (4) fine principal,
<line: 73> (5) fine interest, (6) 'community restitution, (7) penalties, and (8) costs, including cost of prosecution and court costs.
